Title: Deputy Manager Research Development
Dislikes:
One of the worst in terms of work life balance. 
Too much toxic culture.
Your reporting group leads or rather those incompetent SMGRs makes it more miserable. They have no idea what they want, no clarity in their minds. They just follow 'yes sir' approach to satisfy the egos of their bosses. Always it feels like war room situation.I have seen people in early 30s having back injury, spondylitis, etc due to extreme long working hours, and even after all these your superiors will not even bother to ask about your well-being, rather they will always poke you for more work!
They will call even on weekends to work. Also, if company is giving you holiday as per govt rule, they will compensate that by making you work on Saturday, as 8-14 Saturdays are working on an avg per year!
Not good for an aspirational individual who wants to succeed in career. If you want a secured job with yes sir attitude, then this is your company. All the best!
Earlier Maruti used to be pay master but now they r no where near to what others are offering....Read More

Title: Territory Service Manager
Likes: People praises job security in Maruti but what if company makes you leave in first place. We should praise other factors more. And in MSIL, they are making every other thing worse.
Dislikes:
No one knows management's internal agenda but culture revolves around it. And culture always shifts from top to bottom. Top management decides what work culture they want to establish to achieve their agenda. 
In my 9+ years of experience, I have seen a good company to become a hostile. You can ask any employee and he will tell you that he wants to leave on priority. 
Things which are going wrong....
Work environment - KRA is being set in start but during whole year no one will ask or monitor those parameter. You are mostly doing things which will never be asked during review. Every few days, there is a new wave comes for some parameter on which complete ecosystem shifts and starts behave like fire fighting happening. Each and every hour you will be answerable. Some time you feel is it really contributing to company's revenue. 
Learning - No one talks about it. The day you join this company, from next day you are answerable for your performance. They want result by next day. Even if it is impossible. You wont have time to learn any new skill. The only thing you will do whole day is following up with dealers.
Innovation - Everyone knows about it how much MSIL is innovative. 
Work Life Balance - One day, a very senior executive tells his team, Who wants work life balance??.. Any one who wants life, leave this company and enjoy life. Here you only have to do work... 
Politics - It happens every where. Specially if your company is purely Indian. 
Salary - Initially, MSIL was known as pay master but now company started bench marking with other companies and slowly reducing increment amount....Read More

So I don't think it's a technically challenging or career progressive platform for engineers. And retention rate of engineers is very less and since diploma grads have very few options outside Maruti they stick on to their roles till retirement which means in the they form a majority of the chunk in the middle and top management. Title: Territory Sales Manager
Likes:

Appraisal system is a fraud. You're stagnated within a few months. A person with 10+ years experience is doing the same work as an MT, sometimes even lesser, and earning double the salary for it. Title: Assistant Manager
Likes: They are not! If 10 hours of work everyday was not enough now they are making the employees sit at their desks for the entire day with so many interdepartment movement restrictions. Everybody needs to talk to each other via calls and skype and masks and shields must be on all the time. You know where else can we have a similar arrangement without making out lives miserable? At our homes! If no movement is allowed and we have to sit our desks all day long, why can't we just do it at home? It is surprising that nobody in such a big company has the brains to come up with a better strategy. Work from home should be a basic right of an employee specially in critical times like these, while they are making us work in office, where coming to office has no advantage over WFH except getting to see your manager's face all day long....Read More
Dislikes: The work culture is awful. Office politics is everywhere and the most unbelievable part is that there is nowhere to sit in the entire campus that they are so proud of for some reason. The only place you can sit is your work place. Surprisingly even in the healthcare center there are only 2 benches. If you are unwell and are unable to come they can't force you to come because of the "HR policies", but that doesn't stop them from stressing you out about your attendance percentage falling and impacting your yearly bonus. So apparently they give you 44 holidays every year but they won't let you consume them because your attendance impacts the department attendance and they care way too much about that....Read More

Title: Assistant Manager/manager -(technical)
Likes:
Sacrifice for your feelings and aspirations( to live your life happily ) once you join Production Vertical, You can only keep your career progressive and continue only if you have some senior level person in your contacts. You will learn/gain few interesting Qualities if you get a chance to work in Production those are Diplomacy, professional politics, Discrimination, Flattering, Attitude, Egotism, Pressurising subordinates, How to tolerate less qualified and not skilled seniors in shop floor. 
Here's Flattering worth more than any degree. No English, No IT Skill reqd, No logical sense, No Report making reqd if one keep his boss happy by flattering or "Yes Sir- Yes Sir". Here few people reaches to manager level without any Diploma/Degree or other relevant skills for that position, Seriously and those may be your reporting managers also. 
Only Production has this amazing culture. other areas are ok You will get what u deserve. 
In Production, you will be blatantly told and compelled to stay after your working hours till your boss sits....Read More

I have a 3 years of experience. I work in production division so all reviews are purely based on my experience in production division. First the good thing:- The promotions & Grades do not affect your salary to much so you have to least bother about being at top. Compensation is better among the industry but the raise is not in terms of percentage of last drawn salary its purely on your designation 
bracket. You have barely has to stay back. You can't access your mail from home so no work pressure at home. 
The Medical facility is best in private sector. 
The Number of leaves you get is also more than enough. 
& there are various HR scheme for employees which are really very best in industry. 
Now the cons:- There is always a unnecessary pressure of management. MSIL Still in mode of a government organization where post is everything.
You are always  being theartend regarding your grades. 
The whole department atmosphere is dependent on the department Head. 
No bus facility  in General Shift...Read More

Title: Customer Care Manager
Likes: Have h good experience and learn so many things ..
Dislikes:
Very good learning opportunities. Pay scale is best in segment (4 wheel automotive). Lot of employee benefits & additional perks which are over & above CTC, eg: health insurance for family & parents as well at no additional cost, Diwali gifts of worth >10k,  profit sharing which is famous as "Alpha" (approx 3~4lac for manager level)etc.
Block closure holidays of 1 week in both June & December.
All leave (21PL,10SL,6CL) will be encashed & no leaves will be lapsed. (Very rare in any industries)
Gurgaon R&D unit is at very good location & hence easy to commute to company....Read More

Title: Assistant Manager Supply Chain Management
Likes: The advantage of working in India's largest passenger vehicle manufacturer is that there is tremendous opportunity to learn best in class processes and systems. The compensation is one of the best in the industry for each job level. I joined the organization as a Graduate Engineer Trainee (GET), and exited the organization as an Assistant Manager in the Supply Chain vertical. Although each vertical has its own essence, but in my opinion the Supply Chain vertical and Production vertical are where there can be maximum learning for a young engineer. To summarize, I would strongly recommend the company to a youngster who is willing to learn and be associated with a very strong brand in the country....Read More
Dislikes: Due to the importance of Supply chain to the bottom line of the company, the going can get very tough sometimes. When I was there in the company i.e. 2014-16, Saturday was working, but now I have got to know that weekends have been kept off across the firm. But for whom work life balance is a priority, Maruti Suzuki is not the most ideal company.

Title: Technician
Likes: If money and job security are the only things you care about, this is the place for you. While they don't pay exorbitantly, the compensation is better than the industry average. Also, you don't really have to care about job security as their revenues are stable and performance at an individual level is rarely taken into consideration.
Dislikes: The top management is often blind to problems at the ground level. Amidst the push for higher targets, the japanese management scrambles for control and direction. The middle management is most corrupt (and incapable to a certain extent) and getting things done mostly depends on personal relationships instead of having a shared objective. HR processes such as performance appraisal etcetera are reduced to mere formalities and paperwork. Overall, it does not provide a vibrant and enriching environment to work. It is just a safe haven for mediocre people....Read More

Title: Manager
Likes:
1) When it comes to Job security, nothing beats Maruti Suzuki. 
2) Management thinks and works for the employees learning skills. Company provides lot of training activities for their skill development. 
3) MSIL management is very focused. This helps us while dealing and negotiating with vendors. 
4) Compensation and yearly bonus istoo good.
5) Direct approach to senior management. Though it is expected to follow hirerchy. 
6) One of the best place to work for female employees in manufacturing sector. 
7) Medical facility is Good.
8) Seniors are very helpful. Again it depends on how your boss is.
9) 5 days a week for non production department. 6 days a week for production and related department....Read More
Dislikes:
1) Work pressure is very high especially in Production and Quality departments. 
2) Work life balance is good in specific area.
3) Management expectations is very high. May be because the MSIL is leader in passenger car segment in India.
